title: Fifth arrest announced in fatal shooting at Fulton Avenue hookah lounge
content:
Sacramento County sheriff’s officials have announced the arrest of a fifth and final suspect in the fatal shooting of 20-year-old Tyrell Hall in July at a hookah lounge on Fulton Avenue.
Detectives have arrested Salvador Ramon Martinez, 19, and expect this to be the final arrest in the case, according to a Sheriff’s Department news release.
Four other people were arrested in connection with the shooting: Frederick Lamont Davis, 28, Tana Dania, 23, Frank Jackson, 19, and James Wallace, 28
Martinez was a close friend of Hall and was standing near Hall during the incident when the gunfight began. Detectives think Martinez initiated the gunfight that resulted in Hall being shot and killed.
The case has been turned over to the Sacramento County District Attorney’s Office for prosecution.
